item.title: Introduction to Action Constraints in ASP.NET Core
item.description: Ever had to integrate a 3rd party webhook into your application, only to realize that they won’t let you configure a different address for each type of events? A few years ago, I had to do just that for Github webhooks. Thankfully, they provide a HTTP header that describe the type of event being sent. At the time, I used a middleware to modify the route, but there are cleaner solutions out there.
